Reviews.Title: “Cruise Port Hotel”
Reviews.Author: karin2000
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a Royal Caribbean cruise out of Baltimore. We stayed at the holiday inn express and left our car there for the week. It was easy to get to, they have a shuttle that took us to the main area for dinner, picked us up and then transported us to/from the port. All of the staff was great and it made the vacation relaxing knowing we only had to call the hotel and we were picked up within 30. I would stay there again if I were taking a cruise...

Reviews.Title: “"Holiday Inn-->Express" to the Pier”
Reviews.Author: Marnette S
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at the Holiday Inn Express Baltimore at the Stadiums on March 18, 2012. Our travel agent booked a package which included the Express Start Breakfast and seven nights free parking with shuttle service to the Baltimore Cruise Terminal the next morning. Our cruise was 12 nights; we paid an additional $5 parking per day for parking for the remaining 7 nights. This was a nominal charge for secured parking in a gated area along the side of the hotel, accessible with the room key. Additional parking is available in the back of the hotel in a large lot, also the location of the outdoor pool. Leon ensured a smooth check-in. We registered for a 10:30 a.m. shuttle with our 5 checked bags. Shuttle service also is provided to the Inner Harbor every 30 minutes. It is suggested that guests not walk to the Inner Harbor or M&T Bank Stadium, even though these venues are within walking distance. We walked around the property and found a paved path one block away for exercise purposes. We did not use the path the following morning but opted for the Fitness Center. The hotel is in a commercial and industrial area. Several gas stations (BP, Shell, Exxon) are very near the hotel. Exxon sells Subway and the BP sells gyros. Room 434 is a non-smoking room with two queen beds overlooking Russell St. We were not bothered by street noise but, rather, entertained by a diverse parade of passersby. The hotel is a “re-launched” Holiday Inn property, decorated in neutral colors. The room (and hallways) are well lit with a spacious desk and internet port. There is a refrigerator but no microwave, which we are accustomed to having in all HIEX properties. We found a powerful microwave at the end of the hall in the “Priority Club Lounge,” available to any guest with a room key. The internet description lists microwave and refrigerator among the amenities – a little misleading. Our room had great water pressure in the sink and tub. The bath towels were quite rough but not stained; there were plenty of towels and washcloths. The beds were very comfortable with four pillows and triple sheeting with a duvet. The bathroom had the usual amenities: two bars of soap; shampoo, conditioner and lotion. There is a grab bar in the tub and a curved shower rod. The room has a flat screen LG TV and a four-cup Hamilton Beach coffee pot with a deep basket. I mention this feature since we prefer to bring our own filters and coffee. There is a nice lounge area in the lobby and the largest breakfast area I’ve ever seen in a HIEX including two large flat-screen TV’s at one end of the room and several smaller flat-screen TV’s above the tables for two on the room’s perimeter. Other public spaces include one nice-sized meeting room with round tables and one smaller meeting room. Also available is a well-stocked display of brochures for area attractions and transportation. The Fitness Room is available 24/7 including one universal weight machine, two treadmills, a stair stepper and 2 TV’s. The Business Center, also available 24/7, has two computers and a printer. I was able to access the Cruise Critic and TripAdvisor websites with no problem. We departed the hotel at 11:00 a.m. on March 19 and arrived at the port at 11:10 a.m. Since there were several cruisers at the hotel, one van held the luggage while passengers went in a separate vehicle. Hotel personnel took charge of the bags and handed them off to the port handlers. Be certain to keep your carry-on with you in the van or it may go to the ship as part of the checked bags. We had a business card to call the hotel after the cruise. Hint: store the phone number in your cell phone; on disembarkation day, the port is congested and busy with many cruisers and their luggage with no time to search for the business card. We were off the ship (Royal Caribbean’s Enchantment of the Seas) by 9:20 a.m. We waited 30 minutes for the shuttle, a normal wait time. There is only one way for vehicles to enter the port parking area so it is easy to see the shuttle arrive. You may need to walk to the end of the parking lot with your luggage if the driver is not able to park directly in front of the ‘pick up lot.’ We arrived at the hotel at 10:20. After loading our luggage in the car, a restroom break, and a cup of coffee, we were in our car by 10:45 a.m. I can recommend this HIEX for a comfortable stay, reasonable rate, free breakfast, free parking for seven days and an “express” shuttle to the pier. Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Wheres my mace?”
Reviews.Author: Travelermaddie
Reviews.Content: I had never been to baltimore and stayed here on business one night. It is convienently located near the stadium and gas stations. If you drive you must park in a gated area, and based on the neighborhood I can see why. My room was a single king. It had a window which faced the side street of the hotel and ad I quickly found out an all hours city bus route and local hang out corner for individuals selling... Well I can only venture a guess. The hotel lobby is very nice with a big screen tv and nice decor. The staff was very friendly but for a Friday only one man was working. When I called to request clean towels (the ones in my room has hair in them) they were brought up by a wonderfully sweet man with a badge reading "security". I would venture this hotel is under staffed. This was also apparent because my room was in disrepair, peeling wallpaper, chipped tile, broken wood door, glued back together toilet lid. Additionally my bathroom was quite dirty. Brown hair in the tub and on the floor. Eew. Spend a few extra $$ and just dont stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous staff,shuttle to nearby Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: jwsmith66
Reviews.Content: Staff here at this Holiday Inn extremely courteous and helpful and seem to go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. I like that Holiday Inn Priority Club members have a private little lounge on the floor for some extra room and to heat up food, and table to eat. The shuttle driver also helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Down by the stadiums ...”
Reviews.Author: Glenncca
Reviews.Content: I have had many stays in various HIX properties and this one lived up to expectations In terms of staff friendliness and helpfulness, cleanliness of the property and rooms and the breakfast provided. It was the first time I had to pay to park at HIX (parking is fenced and gated since it is not in the best neighborhood), this should be disclosed when reservations are made.

Reviews.Title: “Really well maintained and staff great!”
Reviews.Author: oldnovice
Reviews.Content: We were not there for a game...but a visit to Johns Hopkins which was made all the easier due to a convenient and friendly shuttle staff. Yes the linens were a bit thread bare and the room less than suite sized as advertised but all and all this is a very good choice if you are going to use a car or shuttle. Not a good choice if you want to walk to the Inner Harbor. The breakfast fare is the typical Express. Staff were seen cleaning and keeping things very immaculate. PS ask for a room that does not front the highway which does have a lot of traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Park and cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: AC-at-Travelbugs
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel if planning on cruising out of Baltimore. The rooms are comfortable, the hotel shuttle will take you back and forth to the port and give you a complimentarty hot breakfast. We booked through International Holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you're going to a game”
Reviews.Author: aredwine
Reviews.Content: This property is in a pretty shady neighborhood, but once you're inside, it's a standard HI-Express. Rooms were clean and updated, although the bathrooms are a bit dated. Free breakfast with this crazy cool automatic hot pancake maker that makes perfect pancakes on demand! Free shuttle to Johns Hopkins Hospital too, which is very convenient and welcomed after a long day with a sick loved one.

Reviews.Title: “easy access”
Reviews.Author: donna e
Reviews.Content: We went on a weekend getaway for no reason, got a great deal on hotwire. The front desk people were some of the most helpful and nice ever. The parking fee was a thing but the lot was most secure. Breakfast was ok for "FREE"..husband liked the machine to make your own pancakes.be aware if you are coming from the city and do not make the turn to this hotel there is no exit for at least 3 or more miles on the highway..we found out the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Good place stay .”
Reviews.Author: 1972Kim
Reviews.Content: Stayed night before cruise .Slept well my car was safe Shuttle service was great and the free breakfast was nice .Also made friends that were also cruising would definetly stay again. It cost me less to stay then pay for parking. The only reason for the my overall rating was 4 is because once we got settled in room discovered tv did not work and had to pack back up and move to another room.

Reviews.Title: “Great for tourists on a budget”
Reviews.Author: clh6262
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business and this hotel was just fine. As a former resident of Baltimore, I would say that this location is safe enough. It is also very convenient to the highway. The other Holiday Inn Express in Baltimore is in a much worse neighborhood with an awful parking situation. This one has fenced parking with keycard access. I felt safe leaving my car there. The hotel itself has clean, nice rooms with large t.v.s, mini fridge, coffee maker and hair dryer. The walls are a little thin so you can hear people talking in the next room. If you're a light sleeper and happen to get a room next to someone loud - it isn't going to be good. They have a shuttle every hour to the Inner Harbor which is a very nice amenity for tourists. The breakfast room is large with the standard free breakfast. The only suggestion I would make is that they put microwaves in the rooms as a convenience. If I were coming to Baltimore for a game - no question - I would definitely stay here. And I would stay here again because you really can't beat the prices for this quality of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place for families”
Reviews.Author: Jimsgirl1007
Reviews.Content: Ok - First the good points. The room was very clean, had nice amenities. The hallways were very well-lit. Their free breakfast was very good; hot options such as eggs, sausage and pancakes were available. However, on the downside - when we entered the hotel from the rear parking area, there were two transvestites standing in the walkway smoking (I am not making this up). Our window looked out directly on an electrical transformer on a pole at eye level and a street corner where homeless men were begging all night. People were slamming doors and tromping up and down the hallway all night long. There is a $15 per day charge for parking which I had not seen mentioned on the website when I made the reservation. We were only there for one night, as my fiance was attending a work seminar in the area, so it was not a major problem. Had we been staying longer or had family members with us, especially children, I would have been rather uncomfortable with the surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: EI83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the stadiums, both football & baseball and the Inner harbor of Baltimore. Located 1 min off of 695. Shuttles run every hour to all these locations & will run custom trips if they aren't busy. Parking does cost an extra $10 but is in an secure area. Some parking under hotel. Rooms are the same HI standard, nice, clean & quiet. One of my pet-peeves- slamming room doors is non-issue here. Doors have closing mechanics that close them quietly. Hotel staff very friendly. Breakfast area is very large with 2 TVs. 2 elevators make getting to rooms easy & quick. Fitness room is nice, 2 treadmills. Have stayed here a bunch & will continue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly staff, great pool”
Reviews.Author: mdmbfly
Reviews.Content: The staff was great. Just a few blocks from the Harbor. The little shop in the lobby had baked goods and coffee/tea. Very helpful and friendly staff. Seemed safe, no concerns with 4 kids with us. Parking is uncovered and easy to get to. Rooms were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: pcampisi
Reviews.Content: Hotel is about 15 minutes from the airport and just a short drive to Inner Harbor. Rooms were clean and front desk staff very friendly. Parking was kinda tight and cost $10.00. Okay place to stay for just an overnight stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Near the ships, 7-days of parking free included. Shuttle to the ships. This worked well.”
Reviews.Author: wordmobile
Reviews.Content: For what I paid that included parking, this was an excellent value. I used 123stay.com to book this hotel and to get the 7-day free parking (park and cruise). I looked at a lot of options and the consistent issues among ALL the hotels shuttling to the ports was difficulties with the shuttle. So, I ruled out the hotels near the airport and took the Holiday Inn Express neart the Stadium so that if any problems occurred, the cab rides would be inexpensive. TIP: We tried to book directly with Holiday Inn using points, but they charged a fortune for the parking. The best rate was through 123stay.com. I registered with their site, had no problems with them. and their Instructions were good, The hotel had their reservation, All done via the Internet. And, I had a printoff with the reservation number. LOCATION: This is at 1701 Russell Street. A GPS was essential, and will still benefited from printing off a mapquest street map because it's hard to envision that I-295 heading north dumped right onto Russell Street. You don't want to get on the wrong road spurs and head across bridges, etc. The area is a bit industrial and no restaurants nearby except a Subway across the street. Eat before you arrive or plan an excursion and bring along your maps. On the way to the ships, we passed the Stadium. It really seems within walking distance, but not particularly good for walking alongside the roads. Heed other reviews if you are going to the stadiium. THE ROOM: Clean, quiet. And, really that's all of what we needed for this overnight stay. Our room was small and overlooked the gated parking lot. The TV was old, and the bathroom was clean. The sink was outside the BR in the hallway. Good towels. Two queen beds, good mattress, and a ton of pillows for each bed. No hallway noises. This might be different if there's a game at the stadium, so sometimes, maybe you can ask for a quiet room. Maybe some other reviews mention which ones. I think we had to bring all our luggage up to the room. There was no option to store it downstairs. THE BREAKFAST: This was just fine. The night before, we heated some microwave dinners in the oven by the soda machines and sat in that room. Better than eating in the room. The food was a hot breakfast, nice selection of breakfast things. Good coffee, juices, yogurts. THE STAFF: The night-staff person on duty was new, but was handling numerous requests with politeness and calm and clear instructions. Most people were concerned about the shuttles to the boats the next morning.. Obviously, they too had read a lot of reports for the hotels offering the park and cruise. THE SHUTTLE to the boats. They handed out a small instruction note, gave us a choice of shuttle times available. I do think you should do that on arrival or before if they'll allow it. They used two shuttle buses per run. One had the luggage, the other the people. TIP: The vans are a bit hard to get into if you've got any handicap --especially if those front runners take all the good seats leaving YOU to the hard-to-get-to back seat. AAAaaargh. If you've got problems, I suggest alerting the driver, give him you tip early and ask to board first. True to their word, we never saw the luggage again until it appeared in the ship's stateroom. TIP: Make sure you understand where the van will pick you up after your cruise or event and make sure they have a cell phone number for you if they can't find you after you've called for a pickup. PARKING LOT: Locked and lit. I was confortable leaving the car there. They give you a card or a code to get in. To get out, the gates open automatically as you approach them. I think the extra two days parking was at $5.00 / day.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre/post cruise hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vargoge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our family reunion cruise. We took advantage of the AAA discount for our entire group so the rate was very reasonable. Very clean rooms, shuttles to the inner harbor and to the port was no additional charge, but we heavily tipped the driver since we were such a large group. Add the jacked up contental breakfast in the morning, being able to leave your car in the secured and gated parking lot while on the cruise makes this place an excellent value!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Before Cruise”
Reviews.Author: YKS
Reviews.Content: What a great deal!. Stay inexpensively. Shuttle service to innerharbor and back and forth to cruise terminal. Free breakfast not bad. Desk service excellent. Highly recommended Nice and clean hotel, staff very polite Good one day stay before we took our cruise the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for downtown Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: mainetobuffalo
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad place to stay, especially if you're going to a Ravens or Orioles game. It's not far away, and they will run the shuttle. It's a about a half mile walk, fine during the day or in groups, but I'd be cautious at night. The biggest downside to the location is that the neighborhood appears shady. This said, it's industrial so aside from a run down appearance, I don't think it was all that threatening. The hotel is actually pretty nice. Beds are comfortable, very nice hot breakfast buffet, and it definitely felt secure inside. Desk personnel was fine, but they did charge for parking even though I did not have a car. I had to call them, and they did remove the charge.

Reviews.Title: “stay before cruise”
Reviews.Author: HER1
Reviews.Content: What a great deal!. Stay inexpensively and leave your car for the week while you cruise. Shuttle service to innerharbor and back and forth to cruise terminal in 10 minutes. Free breakfast not bad. Desk service excellent. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Cruisers”
Reviews.Author: TravelLovrs
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked us into this hotel on 9/16/11, the night before our RCCL cruise left. for Bermuda. It was right off I-95 and easy to get to, even though we were totally unfamiliar with Baltimore. It is not in the best area, but the hotel and parking area seemed secure. They had nice rooms with inside corridors, a full breakfast, and a free shuttle service to the Inner Harbor. There you can find all sorts of restaurants, shops, and even an aquarium. Steel drum music was playing and it was great sitting next to the water. They also had ships that you could tour. The shuttle service also is free for the cruise port terminal the next morning. The front desk takes reservations for it. They also pick you up the day you disembark from your cruise ship. The hotel is right next door to the Camden Yards and the football stadium. The front desk staff seemed a a bit harried with checking guests in and out, and setting up the shuttles. Parking is free for at least 5 days, with a secured and gated lot. The only issue we had was getting picked up at the cruise terminal when we arrived back from the cruise. We came in at around 7:15am, cleared customs, and called as directed. The front desk told us that the next shuttle would be there to pick us up after 8am. By 8:20, the shuttle still had not arrived. We called again, and they said they had sent it but couldn't find us. This seemed improbable as we were standing right where they told us. They then said another shuttle would be there "soon." We called again at 8:30 and they said they had been there but couldn't find us. After pressing the issue, they said they would be over in 7 minutes. Finally, around 8:45, they arrived and took us and another couple back to the hotel. There was seemed to be some issue with the message getting from the front desk to the driver. We were always at the designated meeting place, and when he did arrive, we saw him immediately. We would definitely stay again at this property if we were cruising from Baltimore. However, we would suggest giving them a cell number so this supposed "missing" each other won't happen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: lunchlady-r
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of august- right before and during Hurricane Irene. We found staff to be very helpful adn attentive. We especially appreciated the shuttle service to the Inner Harbor Area. All of the drivers were excellent and went out of their way to be helpful at a very stressful time. We were able to get a later checkout on sunday. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - if location doesn't matter”
Reviews.Author: CTmom101
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is above average - everything except the location, which is the only reason it didn't get a higher rating. We stayed here on a weekend trip to Baltimore that happened to coincide with the Baltimore Grand Prix. Staff was incredibly accomodating - allowed us to use the pool in the afternoon after we had checked out, allowed our son to take our spot in their lot so we could travel together, and the shuttle dropped us at the southern entrance for the Grand Prix, near the stadium, when we decided to check it out. Room was typical but clean, comfy and all that we expected. The only bummer is that there really is absolutely nothing within walking distance - no where to take a walk or get an ice cream. You can certainly walk back from the stadiums during the day (my 16 year old daughter and I did), but we left before the end of the race and there weren't a lot of people about and it wasn't the most comfortable walk I've ever taken with another woman (and I am a former New Yorker). It's just pretty desolate. If the game is getting out and everyone is leaving at the same time, I think it would be a different story. For us, the location was less of an issue because we were driving around a lot and it is very easy access to the highway, but if you are hoping to use this hotel as your main base and want to walk, this is not the location for you. That said, if you are just using the hotel to sleep and will be driving to your destinations, this place is more than fine. For us, the price was right, location was less of an issue and the staff went above and beyond to insure we had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dont listen to negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: stingray62
Reviews.Content: Took a roadtrip from NY to see a football game. My nephew plays for the Chiefs and they were in town to play the Ravens. Hotel was 4 blocks from the stadium. I was greeted by Mike at the front desk who was professional and explained all the hotel had to offer. Room was clean.Parking lot was fenced inn. More cops on the walk to the stadium than I could count. Just a nice stay. No negative comments here.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: Katfer102
Reviews.Content: Is the only explanation for the bites I woke up with on my leg and my daughter woke up with on her arms. The desk clerk apologized upon check out and refunded me the $10 parking fee. She said she was going to check the room. II have contacted guest relations with holiday inn express' main number and trying to get refunded. They told me that I have to work with the hotel. They will begin an investigation. I'm not optimistic . Also. The surrounding neighborhood is questionable and isn't safe for young women or children to walk to the stadiums alone Regarding the room itself: they advertised there was a flat screen tv..... There wasn't.... After ripping the bed apart checking for the critters I noticed an old stain on the sheet. Also there was old stains on the carpet The AC was loud and they should replace their pillows and mattresses. I obviously do not recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve stay was a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: MyrtleVegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on NYE and really enjoyed it here. We had 3 rooms which were all clean and orderly as expected. The staff were all very plessant and helped us through our minor inconveniences (i.e toiletries we forgot, extra towels and even a parking issue with a late arrival in our party.). Before we set out for the night, the gentleman behind the front desk was kind enough to come out and take a few snap shots for our group and call us a cab so we could enjoy our night. We were also allowed a late check out the following day, which helped with the post new years eve hangover haha.Thanks a lot Holiday Inn Express!!! We enjoyed our stay with no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “great value, don't let the other reviews scare you”
Reviews.Author: cgen5568
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a family trip to baltimore. We went for a baseball game at Camden Yards. The hotel is within walking distance (approx 1 mile ) we took the free shuttle to the stadium one day and walked back (during the day) it was 95 degrees and truly not a bad walk although we were advised not to do it at night. You do need to reserve your seat on the shuttle and schedule a pick up timen to get a ride back. they will provide you with a number to call. If you choose to drive to the stadium which we did the second day it only costs $10 to park right outside the stadium. The hotel itself was clean, the staff terrific and friendly and the breakfast was delicious. we also enjoyed the pool. We have stayed at quite a few hotels and we truly think this was a nice place and in a not so bad neighborhood..I would reccommend this hotel if you are going to a baseball game, if you are going to a football game even better...=)

Reviews.Title: “Be Prepared...”
Reviews.Author: triptakero25
Reviews.Content: Upon check in was very surprised the hotel is not walking distance to the stadium and a shuttle takes you. Also the shuttle service they say picks up every hour but that is also not a fact. We waited 30 minutes and finally took a taxi. Hotel room was not clean, door to bathroom did not close at all and called security three times. A ray of sunshine is the staff who is helpful and accommodating.....

Reviews.Title: “Close to the stadium”
Reviews.Author: siamesecat2965
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an overnight stay in Baltimore for the U2 concert. I chose this hotel as it was within walking distance to the M&T Bank Stadium, where the concert was held. The hotel was clean, staff was friendly and efficient, and you can't beat $10 a night parking in downtown Baltimore. We didn't take the shuttle or try and walk anywhere else, but it was a 4 block, 10 minute trek to the stadium, and while the area might not be the greatest, there were tons of cops and other people around, so as two women, we felt very safe. After getting back, we had a minor issue with our sink, called down to the desk, adn they sent someone up who fixed it within a few minutes! For those who said you can't walk to the stadium, yes, you cannot walk down the main drag, as there are no sidewalks, but if you go back behind the hotel, it's not an issue - just need to do your research! I'd stay there again if i were going to a game or another concert.

Reviews.Title: “It is convenient to the stadium"”
Reviews.Author: Equisport1
Reviews.Content: We just stayed in this property and being part owners of an HIE hotel we know the drill. I read below a review saying it wasn't close to the stadium -- it is. It's three blocks. We were there for a U2 concert and my family (incuding two kids 9 & 12) walked to M&T Bank Stadium in a matter of minutes. It is a bit further to Camden Yards (5 more minutes) and probably a 25 minute walk total to the Inner Harbor. That said, it's not a great part of town, but it's a nice property and it is close to the stadiums. The rooms are clean and nice and the staff is very helpful -- in fact, I just made arrangments with the head of housekeeping to return a watch we left behind. They have parking and a pool. There is no place to eat nearby, but they do run a shuttle to the Inner Harbor. We walked up to Camden Yards, caught a cab to the Inner Harbor, caught another cab back to the stadium for the concert and then walked back to the HIE after the show, no stress. As the saying goes, it is what it is -- It's a nice HIE and it's very convenient to the stadium. If you want the Inner Harbor, stay there, but if you want easy access to either stadium at the HIExpress pricepoint, this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I was not brave enough to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: oldensign
Reviews.Content: Ok I will be honest…I ran from this hotel. I thought it would be in walking distance of the stadiums. It was not. I thought it would be close to the inner harbor. It was not. I thought it would be in a good location. It was not. Be aware this hotel is well away from the tourist area. It is near the Greyhound bus station. When we pulled in there were lots of unsavory folks wandering around. I just did not feel safe putting my family in the hotel or leaving my car outside. As I missed the cut off I had to pay for the night even though I never stayed. I am a really frugal (read cheap) guy so for me to give $$ it had to be bad. Guess I was a chicken as well as cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and staff”
Reviews.Author: roboird
Reviews.Content: This appears to be an older property near the baseball stadium. I was really prepared for a dingy room and mediocre service. Neither was the case. Although the hotel is shows its age, the rooms and every aspect of the hotel were extremely clean. The staff was superb - of our 10 days on the road thus far, they were the friendliest most outgoing of all. Good internet. Typical Holiday Inn Express breakfast. The only downside to the hotel is the 10.00 per night fee to park a car.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: happyhourfun
Reviews.Content: We arrived earlier than check-in time so our room wasn't quite ready. However, they offered a room that was locked for us to put our belongings that we didn't want to leave in our vehicle. This allowed us to get our day started earlier, which was great! We rode the shuttle to the Inner Harbor. This is a great ammenity as parking at the Harbor is more than just a little difficult. Everything was clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The girls at the desk even looked up some tourist info for us. The breakfast in the morning offered a good variety of both hot and cold items, everything was good. We hope to stay at this hotel again next time we are in the area. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “exellent service”
Reviews.Author: Harleymaker
Reviews.Content: very clean with a safe atmosphere and a very pleasant staff willing to help us

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected....Shuttle not reliable”
Reviews.Author: jacq0104
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the weekend to participate in a competition being held at the convention center. It would require several trips back and forth between the hotel and convention center. We had a situation in our group that necessitated reliable transportation because long distance walks were not possible. We made two phone calls directly to the property to make certain that we had a CLEAR understanding of the shuttle service before we booked. Upon arrival - we learned that what we were told was not correct - and in fact - were told that THEY would never have give us THOSE details - it must have been a rep from corporate that gave us the wrong information. Upon check in - we were told that the shuttle only runs once each hour - and only the first 13 people that sign up can get on it. When we asked if we could have a cab called - we were told "Oh Friday - it takes at least a half of an hour to get a cab over here". We were also told that the shuttle would NOT be available for from 10 - 1 on Saturday, because they would only be taking 'cruise' people to their port during that time. We were given a card with a number to call for pickup when we went out on Friday night. We we called for pickup, we were told - the shuttle only makes 2 stops - one at the convention center (at a specified corner) and one at the aquarium. The website and corporate BOTH say that the shuttle takes you anyplace in a 3 mile radius inside of the city. Needing a ride - we agreed to meet the shuttle at the convention center and were told ...."Start waiting at 8 o'clock - he'll be there eventually". When it arrived - the only way that our party of 6 would fit - is if we 'stacked' people. Within another block - he stopped again to pick up 2 more folks. The driver said - don't worry - I am getting you all in there! I believe that we ended up with at least 16 people in back of the shuttle van - children stacked on parents. There is NOTHING to do around this property. If you would like to pop out to grab a bite to eat - there is nothing here. Before making reservations were told that if you had to walk to the convention center - it would be about 20 minutes. Absolutely no way - nor would you want to. There are desserted lots - and underpasses that you would have to walk past and thru - They did offer (eventually) to 'try and have transportation available there on Saturday during the otherwise unavailable hours....but they could not guarantee it". Not what we needed. Our exit was not lovely - but we did not stay at the property. With assistance from the Priority Club (NOT the front desk staff) - we moved to the Holiday Inn, Inner Harbor (which was very lovely). The room at this property was not above average - and the view that we had of the highway was not the best. Trains could be heard in the short time that we spent in the room. The bathroom was TINY. The property did not look new in any way. So - if you are there to attend a game and need only to walk to the stadium - book today! If you need reliable transportation to the convention center (or anywhere else) and you were planning to use THIS hotel's shuttle service - think again. We had never been in Baltimore before - and chose this hotel because the advertised shuttle service APPEARED to meet our needs - it did not. There is nothing around this property - so getting into the Inner Harbor area was a must.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and convenient shuttle to convention center.”
Reviews.Author: MeganLD
Reviews.Content: Used Hotwire. Wasn't sure what to expect but it was a very reasonable rate with extremely helpful staff and a convenient shuttle to the convention center and inner harbor. Tasty breakfast and nice hotel gym. Cab was $6 to convention center if shuttle times didnt work out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: delawaremir
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a hotel/cruise package. Couldn't believe how convenient it was to locate. Once checked in, they have a free shuttle to take you to several downtown locations, one being Inner Harbour. The front desk assistant, Michael, made check in extremely easy; giving me all the information I needed for our stay. He was friendly, helpful and efficent. The hotel had a nice cozy room; good breakfast in the morning; the best part; leaving our vehicle at the hotel for a week and having the free shuttle to and from the ship. Great time and it's easier and cheaper to stay here then park at the port. Had a wonderful dinner and relaxed prior to cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttles Are Good”
Reviews.Author: Amesk
Reviews.Content: This place was on the OTHER side of the stadiums, not in town. But the shuttle runs on the hour and stops at Inner Harbor, and places between. I can't say enough nice things about the staff here. The shuttle driver (Mr. Tyrone I believe) was very nice and the front desk staff (Mike and the ladies) were top notch. Our room was clean and offered a lovely view of the backside of M&T Stadium. We'd stay here again because it's cheaper than the Holiday Inn Inner Harbor, and everything you need is a shuttle ride away.

Reviews.Title: “great value, good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: jveverett
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for one night and was plesantly surprised! got the booking at the last minute from priceline, so i didn't know which hotel i was getting. upon checking in, which went quickly and efficiently, i got to my room and was again plesantly surprised. the room was clean, spacious, and well kept. bathroom was nice sized and contempory. plenty of fluffy clean towels too! pillows supplied came in firm and soft. a feature i never encountered before. mattress was firm, no euro/pillow top here, which i appreciate. breakfast was included and satisfactory. breakfast area was spacious and clean. i thought the multiple tvs that were located throughout the room should have been set on closed caption as they were mostly distracting and no one was paying the shows anyhow. $10.00 parking fee isn't that bad, but the lot was full (i suspect that they provide long term parking for cruise people because the lot is very large and many of the cars were snow covered when i got there indicating that they were there for some time). so i had no choice but to park on the street. the area seems less than secure, but with no choice i hoped for the best. next morning my car was still there, so no harm, no foul. i would think that they could at least provide closed curcuit monitoring of the areas around the hotel to add a level of safety. minor problem with the exaust system in bathroom, it made a made an audible whine, which was annoying. i solved the problem by closing the door at night. overall a good value for the budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ClearTurquoiseWater
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place for New Years Eve and we were very pleased. We had a total of 3 rooms which were all clean... standard decor for a Holiday Inn. They allowed us to do a late check out the following day which was nice since it was New Years day!!! The breakfast was okay also. A special thanks to the staff... A friend of mine arrived at the hotel and the parking was full so a staff member moved his car so she could park... NOW THAT IS SERVIC!. Also, prior to going out on the town for New Years the gentleman behind the front desk took several pictures for us and made us feel very welcomed. Thanks for a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great stay -- highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: DesiPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this establishment prior to a cruise leaving from Baltimore. The staff is very courteous, friendly, and efficient. My room was great. Only two small negatives. The temperature of the water in the shower was not as warm as I like it. The shuttle service was okay, with some slight improvement needed. If you need a shuttle during the times that guests are being transported to cruise terminals, you may have to wait or take a taxi. Coming back from the cruise, it was cold outside and we had to wait about 45 minutes for the shuttle to pick us up and several phone calls were made. The continental breakfast was nice. I appreciated using the business center, which was helpful. The secured parking was terrific too. This is a well run, great hotel, and I look forward to a future stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: iadviseU
Reviews.Content: This place rocks. It's only 2-3 blocks from the stadium. It was clean and the staff was overly polite! The parking was a little tight but that is expected for downtown Baltimore. I had a pleasant stay and will go back again. I think the room was $120.00 for two Queens.

Reviews.Title: “Lock was Broke”
Reviews.Author: fishinonthenet88
Reviews.Content: Imagine just pulling your top over your head and having some strange man walk in to your room. I stayed here for 2 nights so that I could take my husband to watch his beloved Dolphins play football for his birthday. My husband went down to grab us a muffin & coffee, I jumped in to the shower. I was pulling my shirt on over my head when our door opened and some other man with coffee for his wife came walking in. It seems that his key also opened our door. He was just as embarrassed as we were upset. My husband and this stranger both went to the front desk to get the keys reprogrammed. The staff were friendly but unable to fix the problem. The stranger's key still opened our door. Now how would you feel? We asked for a new room - all booked. We waited half an hour for a maintenance man to come up when he said he was going to follow us right up. Was the door fixed? We have no idea, all we could do is sleep with the deadbolt on the door and one eye open. Our tv remote was broken which at first was just an annoyance but after the lock it was just the icing. We will never go back. Now if the manager replies to this with the standard statement as below, you will know it is computer generated crap.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: babarage
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because we were to attend a game at the Ravens Stadium. Even tho we were really early for checkin we were greeted very friendly and our room was ready within minutes. Deskstaff was the best during our stay there. Very friendly and helpful, especially at night when I was trying to find a place to order dinner from who would deliver with all the chaos around the stadium. The hotel looks really nice inside and out. Our room was very nice as well with everything you would want. Breakfast the next morning was good as well. We used the shuttle to go to the stadium but walked back since it was only a 10-15 minute walk. People have complained about the neighborhood, well it is a bit run down and you are in the middle of warehouses and what have you but it didn't feel unsafe at all. Parking (10$) was in a secure parking lot. All in all I would be quite happy to stay here again if only because of the absolutely great staff !

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express has great provisions for those taking cruises out of the Port of Baltimore.”
Reviews.Author: laurie50207
Reviews.Content: It was a God-send that we discovered the Holiday Inn Express Baltimore at the Stadiums. We enjoyed an overnight stay before departing on our 7-day cruise and were able to leave our car in a secured lot until our return. The staff was delightful and worked well together to see that everyone was shuttled as needed. They cared that we were having the best experience possible.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location...Great Staff...Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: iteachpc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in October with my college-aged daughter. We were attending a band competition that my son was participating in at Towson University. My son's entire band also stayed here as well. The hotel staff was super nice and helpful. Room was neat and clean, though a bit smaller than some hotel rooms. Breakfast was included. There were plenty of choices each morning and they kept everything well-stocked right up until the very end. We enjoyed the biscuits and gravy! This hotel is very close to the Raven's stadium and on our second night there were lots of people staying here that were going to the game. I'm sure the hotel was close to capacity, but we were not disturbed by noise or any other guests. Hotel was easy to find and I would definitely stay here again. We were only about 30 minutes from Washington, DC, too!

Reviews.Title: “Great place !!!! Highly recommend !!”
Reviews.Author: fayem1133
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific place to stay when crusing !!! They are awesome to take you back and forth to the inner harbor and the port of call for the ship. They also wll pick you up when you depart the cruise . It did take about 30 minutes for them to arrive but they did a exellent job !!!!!!!!! Very curtious people and they were also VERY helpful !!!!!!!!! Thanks for a wonderful stay !! A++++

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Chozz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many higher rated hotels than this, but to be honest this was a great stay. The rooms were very spacious and extremely comfortable, very good in terms of sleep quality. AC was a little loud but thats only a minor gripe. The hotel offers free wi-fi and free breakfast which is something extremely rare but very much appreciated. The staff at the front desk were friendly and even great fun. The shuttle to the inner harbour is helpful and runs on the hour. A little bit more awkward to get back to the hotel, as you have to phone for a return trip. But a taxi won't cost much from the city anyways, can't say its advisable to walk back to the hotel at night. Oh and there is even a pool on site too. A thoroughly enjoyable and pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “would go back”
Reviews.Author: krisquig
Reviews.Content: all staff were VERY friendly, approachable, and helpful...from the moment we got there to the moment we left. everything else was average, nothing horrible, but nothing too amazing, but it was expected. one website listed this hotel as inner harbor, but we had to take a shuttle to get there, didn't expect that, but no big deal, just a 5 minute ride. if i was going to a ball game, i would have rated the location higher. the area around the hotel was a little iffy. i would go back in the future for the service and price $10 parking per night

Reviews.Title: “No ac; located on highway in run-down area; not real close to Camden Yards”
Reviews.Author: Orb
Reviews.Content: We spent a very unpleasant night here. The AC was not working and when we contacted the front desk, they kept us waiting over 30 minutes only to tell us there was nothing they could do. We called the manager the next day and he did not even bother to call us back. Also, they say they are the closest hotel to Camden Yards. Not so. They are close to the Football stadium but it would be a long walk along 295 to get to Camden Yards. Also the surrounding area is deserted and rather gritty. Do yourself a favor, stay somewhere else. Somewhere with a responsive management and someplace that has a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LifelongNJresident
Reviews.Content: The courteousy shuttle service saved us a lot of $ in parking fees. My wife and I were satisfied with the overall condition of our room and the pleasant and professional staff. It can be a bit noisy if your room is situated near the highway, but we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly modern, attractive, and comfortable inside; neighborhood seedy”
Reviews.Author: amwdew
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here and found the hotel totally modern and very comfortable, with great beds and spacious rooms. Given the rate we got (about $114/night), we were especially pleased with most aspects of the hotel. The breakfast was a bit of a letdown, as they did not offer great nutritious choices (lots of cinnamon rolls, etc.), and the orange juice dispenser (one of those that mixes water with concentrate on the fly) didn't work very well. The protected parking area was nice, especially given the seedy neighborhood in which the hotel sits. It's within sight of the Ravens stadium, but the surroundings look like an abandoned industrial zone. You certainly could NOT walk anywhere interesting from this hotel, and if you want to go to the Inner Harbour, you will need to drive or take their shuttle. But if you just need a comfortable place to sleep that is relatively near downtown Baltimore, this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: blu35
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express at the stadiums in baltimore was awesome.The staff was kind and the room was ok. The location was literally 2-3 minutes from the inner harbor. They provided free shuttle to the harbor which was great. i can't say enough about the staff they have there, just great service. Thank you for making our stay comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly average rooms and horrible service”
Reviews.Author: drinkdkool8
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to Baltimore for a show and knew it would too late to drive back to Virginia so we booked this Holiday Inn in advance. We arrived at 6:45 and it took 30 min to get checked in because the one person behind the counter wrapped up in a conversation with the group in front of us. They were already checked in, but we had to wait for there conversation to end. Then he left for 10 min to take them in the back somewhere. After finally checking in and getting our things in the room, which hadn't had the A/C on so it was about 95 degrees in the room, we asked if the shuttle could take us to our 8:00 show, it was now 7:30. The venue was 1.5 miles away, but we had to show the receptionest how to work google maps so that he could find it. The driver made us wait for another 20 minutes while he talked on his cell phone. At that point another 12 people had shown up for rides. After stuffing everyone in the van, it was now 8:00. I thought that we would be dropped off first since our destination was the closest, but the driver took all the other passengers to their locations all over Baltimore and then turned to us and said he did not know how to get to where we wanted to go because he didn't live in Baltimore and was not familiar with the are. This was the shuttle driver? After showing him the the map again, he dropped us off about two blocks from the venue. It was now 8:40. The hotel itself was fine, but the staff was the rudest I had ever encountered. Maybe it was just bad luck or bad timing, but I have never seen a hotel staff treat you like you were a burden as they did to us.

Reviews.Title: “not the greatest location for baseball fans”
Reviews.Author: greenmonster18
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a baseball game. The front desk person didn't know how to give directions for travellers coming from the Light Rail Camden Yard station. The hotel is close to the football stadium, but if you are going to the Camden Yard, you need to walk through a run-down area or along a highway, so I recommend you take the hotel's shuttle service to the nearby convention center. Keep in mind, though, that the shuttle doesn't run on time or frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right near the stadium”
Reviews.Author: Wolin
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The room was large and clean. The staff super friendly. The free shuttle to and from the ball park was a nice touch (it was close enough to walk though). I enjoyed breakfast. The window in our room could be opened, yaah fresh air. Parking is $10 per night. Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Picadillyduo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. We were going usto the baseball game and we wanted a hotel nearby, we actually walked! The hotel was clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful especially the young gentleman at the front desk. The breakfast was one of the best we ever had! They had shuttle service both to the harbor and to the ballpark. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good rate”
Reviews.Author: July7Bride
Reviews.Content: Hotel seems relatively new and in good shape. Fenced in parking lot behind hotel. Front desk was busy but friendly. Priority Club members receive bag with water and snacks. Area just south of hotel is pretty sketchy so be careful of where you are going. Low rate offered for Johns Hopkins patients (arranged through the hospital). Noise from road was fairly loud in room (we were on the front), so request a room on the back side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn does boutique style”
Reviews.Author: staceyandkevin
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with this Holiday Inn, the room was really chic, the staff very friendly, and the morning breakfast had quite the selection. It looked like Holiday Inn was trying to go "boutique style", while not a boutique hotel, it sure provided that vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: MadArchaeo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to our cruise because the hotel was located less than three miles from the port and offered a cruise package, saving much money over parking at the port! It also offers regular shuttle service to the Inner Harbor and the stadiums - free! Indeed, the football stadium is within walking distance and while the immediate neighborhood isn't terribly inviting, it's so easy to get to the touristy areas, that doesn't matter - and the price is right. We enjoyed our snowed-in stay, with several restaurants to select from for in-room/hotel delivery (which they did, bless them). The breakfast bar is fine, with great cinnamon buns and good coffee among the usual selections. The staff is friendly and helpful and the shuttle ran on time, even when we returned to the massive Feb. 6 blizzard. This is not a luxury hotel (in fact, I suspect it's mostly a business hotel), but it was clean (well, the carpet in our room could have been spiffed up a bit), we slept soundly, everything worked and we didn't miss our boat! Jeez, we even felt smarter for having stayed there -lol The pix give you an idea of the neighborhood - and the snow!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay...”
Reviews.Author: NanD114
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at this hotel before a cruise; our plan had been to drive the hour from Virginia to the port on cruise day but wanted to get to Baltimore early to try to get ahead of a large snow storm. The staff was especially helpful on all accounts. Our room was very clean and well equiped. The free complimentary breakfast was the most extensive I've seen, with lots of hot items; it was much appreciated on a snowy morning. We utilized the cruise package with hotel parking and shuttle to the pier. There were quite a few folks exercising this option, so it was a little slow as required numerous trips of the van, but worked out fine in both directions. Would recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Sweater left, hotel notified within half hr & not found. No response from management!!!”
Reviews.Author: ebw27
Reviews.Content: Stayed Oct 31 @ hotel & half hour after leaving realized had forgotten sweater in closet. Hotel was notified & said they'd note it. We had given them rm # also. We came back after football game & no one could find it. I called the following Tuesday to check if it had shown up since Sunday. I left message for housekeeping to call me. NO RETURN PHONE CALL Again, I called Wednesday & left message on housekeeper's voice mail. AGAIN...NO RESPONSE Again, Thursday called & was put thru to general managers' v.m & DID NOT get return call from her either !! I CALLED back again & she was in meeting & desk attendant DID check for the sweater to no avail. I asked her to have G.M. call me b/c of the incident & HAVE NOT GOTTEN ANY PHONE CALL TO DISCUSS THIS PROBLEM WITH THIS HOTEL !!

Reviews.Title: “Looked brand new, but in the ghetto”
Reviews.Author: DoctorRock
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel for a night on Hotwire for 50 bucks. The hotel looked pretty new, but if you examined things carefully it was probably at least a couple of years old. Despite it's location being sold as Inner Harbor it was ten minutes drive away at the edge of what looked like a pretty dodgy neighbourhood. Rooms were large, clean and well decorated, could have done with some new sheets there were a couple of cigarette burns on them. Breakfast wasn't that good, it never is at these hotels. The staff were friendly enough and the free shuttle bus to Inner Habor was pretty good. I'd recommend going to Obrycki's Crab House on E Pratt for a crab dinner (I'd cab it or drive there and be prepared to get messy!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: morenainsc
Reviews.Content: Very new hotel. Rooms were clean.... the mattress was the best I've ever slept on! Everyone woke up the next morning so rested and agreed that the mattress was the best! The complimentary continental breakfast was also the best one I've ever had. I'd call if a continental buffet. The staff was very nice and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: JeanneD12
Reviews.Content: we had a great time and it was right where we could go see attractions!! nice staff and great breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, very clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: xjfan
Reviews.Content: Late review but wanted to give our experience. The staff was friendly, rooms were very clean. Free breakfast in the morning, nothing fancy but decent. Would recommend this location to anyone visiting. Also had easy access to the highway...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for visiting Camden yard”
Reviews.Author: kyms9
Reviews.Content: We loved the proximity to the ball field as well as the proximity to walk to the inner harbor in Baltimore. Very nice area of the city and enjoyable for sure. The front desk clerks were very nice and even quickly offered amenity items I had forgotten with a smile. The room itself was lovely remodeled however if you look at the doors throughout they look old and take a lot away from the remodeled look through out the rest of the room and hotel. The view from our upper level room was okay, I know if we were facing another direction it would have been a better view, but still nice room, great location and friendly staff. would return for sure. By the way internet is only wireless option and can not plug in, I prefer plug in for my work computer...that was the only major drawback for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crazy4Potter
Reviews.Content: Room was neat and clean. Managers were very friendly and accomodating. Breakfast was a nice variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: skfFairfax
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express this past weekend so we would be close to Camden Yards. My main gripe was that when I called (all three times) I specifically asked if this was the Holiday Inn right at the Camden Yards that you can see about 1.5 blocks away. I was assured by three separate people that yes, it was. We followed our directions to the hotel and we both felt we were going in the wrong direction. We arrived and my fiance said this is the wrong hotel (and he was not happy). We went in and asked the lady at the desk and she said there was one closer...it is called Holiday Inn at Inner Harbour; this one was Holiday Inn at the Stadiums. So we were somewhat upset since the main reason we wanted the hotel was so we could walk back and forth to Camden Yards and use our restroom since they are few and far between before they open the gates. The lady said we have a shuttle or you can also walk. We opted to take the shuttle (and was glad we did) and I was baffled by how you could walk on the highway with no pedestrian area. When we got back I asked her about that...she said you don't take the highway, you take the street in back and walk straight down the street. In any event, the shuttle worked fine, except the last run was at 10:00 PM so we missed the end of our baseball game. The other thing that got messed up was our dinner. Since we had to leave the game early and wanted to go somewhere nice to eat, we couldn't because of the shuttle; the food we got at the game that night wasn't that good. The hotel has frozen dinners and a microwave so we thought we would do that...then the fiance suggested we just order a pizza...which we did, but luckily we did so by 10:30 PM cause that is when they close. All in all the hotel, room, free breakfast, staff, shuttle bus driver were all excellent. It would be nice if they offered late runs on game nights and have several delivery places that deliver at least until 11:00 PM. Our view was the man that wanted to clean windows and a vacant lot being demolished. He seemed very non threatening and was just trying to get some money for doing some work. We actually saw more homeless and people begging around the Convention Center. We have reservations at the other Holiday Inn at Inner Harbor in two weeks...the one right at Camden Yards...and I will be anxious to compare the two. There is a Royal Farms being built across the street, which will be good. If they increase the shuttle times to later in the evening so we can watch the full game, it will make a difference on whether we stay there again. I do have a problem with hotels charging for parking...I feel when you stay at a hotel they should guarantee you a place to park for free. It was nice that it was in a gated lot.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: deley27
Reviews.Content: For the money I was not at all unhappy with this hotel. The rooms were fairly clean up to date etc. That being said the "short 10 minute walk to Camden Yards" is a little deceiving, its a mile so only 10 minutes if you walk like a giselle, and across a bridge with no sidewalks. We chose this hotel to be able to walk to the stadium and a check in were instead handed the card for a cab company. The cab was cheap, the people were nice and let's face it we paid a whole lot less than the hotels right next to the stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfortable, Price was right!”
Reviews.Author: bklynKat
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on hotwire at a great discount! We were in Baltimore to attend a baseball game, and took the Bolt Bus from NYC. If you bring your car, there is a $10 nightly charge to park in the lot at the hotel. The shuttle runs every hour and has specific stops, however if you are going somewhere else and you speak with the shuttle driver, they may take you. That was the case for us, and we gave them a nice tip! The area, as others have stated, is very much a non residential, non commercial area. There are a few gas stations, but it is primarily warehouses, it seems like a lot are being demolished. It's super close to the football and baseball stadiums, but I would not recommend walking due to the traffic, and no pedestrian walkway on the bridge. There were 2 squeegee men who spent the days across the street from the hotel offering to wash windows of cars passing by. They were very considerate, and certainly not threatening. The room was clean and comfortable, just what we expected. The breakfast service was good, the cinnamon rolls are always a highlight, the eggs were a bit gritty. Stay here if you don't mind being about 10-15 minutes from the inner harbor. You save quite a bit of money, but you don't sacrifice comfort. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, budget hotel, not as far out as you think”
Reviews.Author: huw2006
Reviews.Content: Was in town for 4 days last week for a convention, the main downtown hotels around the convention centre were all full or charging $200 plus so was pleasantly surprised to find this hotel at $109 rising to $129 during my stay. The location isn't perfect but it's not bad either. A couple of days I walked 20 minutes to the convention centre, the shuttle bus was busy but when it was full the driver came straight back to do a 2nd trip - maybe a more regular hourly (instead of every 2hr) service would be good. I caught a cab back from the Inner Harbour a couple of nights for $10. Rooms were very comfortable, my corridor didn't smell too fresh but the room was spotless. I had access to the Priority Club lounge on the 4th floor but didn't use it as there wasn't any complimentary drinks/snacks there just a large tv ! Breakfast was nice with a mix of hot and cold snacks. The only problem I'd say with the hotel is the lack of local of bars/restaurants - you do need to get to the harbour to eat/drink.

Reviews.Title: “You'll be surprised at the quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: reenie1953
Reviews.Content: Really great place, perfect location if you drive in as parking onsite is affordable ($10/night) and secure. Fast, easy driving access to downtown, Inner Harbor, UMD etc although would not recommend to stay here if you are relying on shuttle, cab, or public transit and aren't particularly adventurous. Not much other than stadiums within walking distance. The room was very comfortable and surprisingly well appointed. Clean & quiet, too. Free WiFi a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - tough neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: YorktownTraveler411
Reviews.Content: I would have given this 5 stars if not for the location, and the significant delay in checking in. My room was not available until 5pm, and there is no place to go in this part of town. There is a big old fence around the parking lot for a reason. That said, it was a beautiful, beautiful room - with every amenity and everything of excellent quality. Shower curtain was mounted too high so there was some floor wetness problem in the bath, but otherwise, this room was as good as one I paid $350/night for last summer at the Renaissance Baltimore. Breakfast was typical Holiday Inn. Rooms were quiet. For $140 in this city, it was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad shuttle...”
Reviews.Author: BugLovin
Reviews.Content: My husband and our friends decided to go to Baltimore to see the Detroit Tigers play and figured this hotel would be our best choice since it is so close to the stadiums. We were really pleased with the overall cleanliness and modern style of the hotel. It was very comfortable and fit all our needs for the weekend. One thing we did have a problem with was the complimentary shuttle service. The shuttle was always right on time, the problem is that there's only one van and several times there was not enough room for everyone who wanted to take the shuttle. When we did not get on the van one time we asked the driver if he could come back after dropping people off and make a second trip. We were told that the shuttle only runs on the hour and that we were basically out of luck unless we wanted to wait another hour. My husband is a platinum Priority Club member with Holiday Inn, so we have had a lot of experience with the chain and found this to be unacceptable. It was good that we were so close to the parks so we didn't have to pay too much for a taxi. Besides the problems with the shuttle, we were very happy with this hotel. Don't let the "oooh the homeless people are scary" reviews keep you away, the few homeless that were in the area were actually very nice. Anytime you stay in an urban area you will experience this, there's really nothing to "beware" about. This hotel was not unlike any other hotel I've stayed at in a large city.

Reviews.Title: “Believe Hon!”
Reviews.Author: hopefulcitydude
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here, a true oasis, brand new and beautiful. friendly staff, HI express priority lounge w/ big screen and comfy chairs, great breakfast, everywhere spotless. safe, despite shady surrounding area. minor issue with entering the gate at nite but staff was there to correct it.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised...”
Reviews.Author: buccofan11
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend stay at the Holiday Inn Express @ the Stadiums simply because I had Pirates/O's tickets and could use my priority club reward night there. I had a more than a few apprehensions about the neighborhood after reading all the reviews on this site....but for once I was pleasantly surprised with a hotel! The hotel was as comfortable and clean as most people on here have shared. Yes, there are a few homeless people hanging around the highway and sidewalks near the hotel and stadium. However, my boyfriend and I walked home from Camden Yards with another couple and found that security guards and police far outnumbered any loiterers on the Saturday night that we attended the game. Since this was my biggest fear with the hotel, I felt compelled to come home and write a review. Maybe some nights it could be different, but this was our experience on a Saturday game night! The $10 a day parking was a steal when combined with the free shuttle. The cab ride to the stadium was less than $4, and the fare home from Inner Harbor was only $7. All in all, I would definitely stay @ this hotel again. We had a great time on our little weekend vacation, and the HI Express definitely exceeded expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel bad neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: JoScarpo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely close to the stadium actually located on the same street as the back entrace to the stadium. All of the nice hotels and nice area of baltimore is by Gate A of the stadium which is by Lombard and Pratt street. You definitely do not want to walk by this hotel. The gas station next door is good to get milk or drinks for the room being that the hotel has no bar or restaurant on site but beware there are homeless people standing outside the gas station waiting to ask you for money. Very uneasy feeling, also a man trying to wash anyone's car window that happened to get stopped by the red light. A cab to the inner harbor or little Italy will cost you $12-$15 one way. You absolutely have to eat at Moe's!! The food is fantastic, the atmosphere and service are incredible and the portions are plenty. We loved Camden Yards and a cab is only $6.00 to the stadium or the hotel does have a shuttle that runs every hour but it is really a large van that gets full very quick especially if it is a Yankees Orioles game. The hotel has a nice breakfast in the morning which is nice especially if you have a family. The bed was extremely comfortable and my toddler had a roll a way bed and it was perfect also. The room was extremely clean and the hotel staff was really nice as it is a new hotel but we did not feel safe outside the hotel I guess thats why the parking is closed in by spiked gates. Would definitely visit Baltimore again but remember stadiums are usually in bad areas of town which is true in this case, next time we will stay at the Renaissance Harborplace right in the middle of the action and just take a cab to the game otherwise cabs back and forth to Little Italy and the Harbor get quite expensive..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Scary Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: loveguru
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, very new, lovely rooms. The gated parking lot was rather troublesome for an alone female business traveler. The neighborhood is a little troublesome, especially as the homeless people approached my car to wash the windshield. Would I stay there again- probably not. However, it is a great value and the staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “So close, and fraction of inner harbour prices”
Reviews.Author: expresser
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to go to Inner Harbour for the weekend. We live about 2 hours from Baltimore and I did a lot of research on price, location, etc. I realized that although the hotel was about 1 mile from the main tourism locations, it had a free shuttle and gated parking for vehicles, which was only $10 for each night, vs some of the closer locations. Plus the rate was $40 dollars less! The decor was new, our room was spacious and a full line up of TV channels, which is rare on our bigger city trips...Breakast was free and a good variety of hot food. The hostess was very helpful and Tiffany at the Front desk gave us some great dinner recommendations....one of which was Fogo De Chao, which was an amazing Brazialian Steakhouse across from the Aquarium...and the shuttle dropped us off right at the door to it! If you want a very close location, without the location price, and friendly, helpful staff....check out this hotel. It also is the first hotel as you come off of 1-95 from the West.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: sk_denny
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for business. Free parking, free breakfast, free internet, excellent downtown location - that all for a great price. Free shuttle was a nice surprise. I used it to get to my meeting at the Intercontinental rather than having to pay for their valet. Not sure how old this Holiday Inn is but it looked brand new. I took few shots of my room, which had everything I needed. It was quiet, super clean, with the new modern furniture, good selection of cable channels, lovely bed with soft sheets, full size mirror (important!), good-size working desk, etc. The bathroom is not very big but perfectly suits to a single traveler. It has all the amenities you need. Ladies will certainly appreciate the big mirror (again), good lighting and plenty of counter space. The business center has 2 computers with medium internet speed. This time I drove my own car, so I liked that the parking was gated and they had a security guy on at night. The front desk was efficient. They even called me when I was late for the shuttle 30 min before my meeting. Except for the fact that I got lost getting back on freeway going home, everything was superb. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “not the best service”
Reviews.Author: agentmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights the last week of August. We used their shuttle service to the waterfront and were never picked up on the way back. After numerous calls to the lobby and being told they were on their way we took a taxi,after waiting over a hour for the shuttle. We came back to the room to a toilet which did not flush. We called the front desk about this and after waiting an hour for someone to come to fix this my husband went down to get someone to come up. The next day we returned to the room about 8:30 Pm and the room had never been cleaned, no new towels or anything. I had to call to get towels. I was very dissappoited to say the least. We are priority club members and have never had a bad Holiday experience before. They did have a very nice continental breakfast, which was one good thing. I think this could be a nice place if the service was better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for the Money”
Reviews.Author: lbeau61
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express from August 5-10th. Before arriving we were a little nervous having read that the area was not the best. There was a homeless man on the side street washing car windows when we arrived by cab from the airport I thought oh no what did we do. We checked in with no problems, the desk was helpful gave us area menus and told us that there was a liquor store that would deliver wine to the hotel if we called and ordered. We got to our room and we were pleasantly surprised the rooms were immaculate, the furnishings and pictures on the wall were very nice. The room we had overlooked the pool. We spent a couple of days by the pool, it was extremely hot the week we were here. The stadium is only a two minute shuttle ride. The shuttle runs on the hour, it is very convenient, you just have to be in the lobby by the hour you wish to go anywhere and then you call them 15 minutes before the hour you want to be picked up. They would drop us at the aquarium in the inner harbor and pick us up at the same place when we called. This was very convenient and the drivers were very friendly and informative. We thought the breakfast was very good , we never ran out of anything and let me tell you by the time we were leaving on friday, the place was full because the redsox were in town. All in All I have to say we would definately stay here again, we never felt unsafe. They have a security guard and the gated parking lot and fences surround the pool so you never felt anyone could just walk in while you were at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “There are Better Options”
Reviews.Author: Baseballlnut
Reviews.Content: The rooms and physical plant are fine. The location, while close to the stadiums, is pretty bad. Nothing nearby and you walk through a pretty seedy area (homeless fellows living along the route). They were understaffed, or poorly staffed. I waited 10 minutes to check in since only one indivdual was at the desk and he was running down a crisis. The Prioity Club Member's room was full of trash, and even after having mentioned it to the front desk, it was never cleaned out over the next 12 hours. The breakfast was good, but again, staffing poor -- ran out of coffee and it wasn't a large crowd. And, with all that, why on earth do they charge for parking at the hotel? Recommend you seek another hotel closer to the stadium on the central city side.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not-so-nice area”
Reviews.Author: hixona
Reviews.Content: The hotel has nice size rooms and it is very clean. We never heard neighbors, slamming doors or outside traffic. The Desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Complimentary breakfast was good. Refrigerator in the room, microwave in the lobby "market". The shuttle does not work from 2-4 in the afternoon, so we were unable to utilize it during our 1 night stay. Gated parking is definately needed in this area. We walked to and from the Orioles game. It was ok during the walk over (daylight) and there was one security guard near the railroad tracks. On the walk back, it was very, very dark and no security guard. Luckily we had a few other Oriole fans walking the same way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Access to Stadiums”
Reviews.Author: TeamMan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in May with a group of 10 guys who came to Baltimore to see a game at Camden Yards, visit the Inner Harbor and tour Fort McHenry. The hotel is located in an area that makes for easy access to these places and others. We walked to the Stadium during the day and there is also a hotel shuttle bus that will take you to the harbor. The front desk staff was both very friendly and very helpful with ideas and tips. The rooms are small, clean and clearly adequate for a few nights. The compleimentary breakfast was good enough. On the other hand, the hotel is located in an old warehouse/industrial area that is not very pleasant, does not appear to be completely safe and where there is nothing else in the way of tourist services (e.g., restaurants, shops). As a result, there is no such thing as "taking a walk around the neighborhood" in the evening. And, if you were to arrive late and hungry, there would be no such thing as going down to the corner for a burger and a brew!

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem in downtown Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: Rusttribe
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express in Baltimore at the Stadiums is by far and away one of the nicest HI Express hotels I have ever stayed in. IN fact, it is just one of the best business class hotels I've stayed in ever! The property appears to be very new and it shows. As you arrive the attractive and modern lobby greets you. The staff here are extremely friendly and I was checked in to my room within minutes. The hotel offers covered, secure parking right at the hotel, however they do charge $10 per day for it. (Probably my only complaint about this hotel). But I guess every property in downtown Baltimore charges for parking.The rooms themselves are much nice than the HI Express nameplate or room price let on. Plush, comfortable beds, stylish furniture and work area, granite counters in the bathroom are all some of the things that make this a great hotel room. The free Hi-Speed internet access is very fast, and the air-con worked very well. The room is a tad on the small size, but for a solo our couple traveler, it is just fine. There are many other perks that make this a great hotel. There is a very nice workout room and pool. On Tuesday night there was a free managers reception just off the lobby that offered free food and drinks including beer. On Wednesday nights there is a free reception for priority club members in their dedicated priority club lounge on the 4th floor. This lounge for members has a large screen TV and nightly soda, water, and snacks. One small gripe about the hotel is the location. The website and hotel brouchures claim the hotel is only 1 mile from the Inner Harbour and Convention Center. That might be stretching things a bit. The hotel is about 3 miles through a not so great neighboorhood. But, the hotel offers a free shuttle to anywhere downtown and back, or taxi cabs run about $7 plus tip. All in all, me or my fellow travelers can't say enough about this hotel. It is a much better value than the overpriced hotels right in the Inner Harbour and perfect for Ravens or O's games!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: hevdaze
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 2 nights while staying for my daughter;s graduation from Loyola College in Maryland. When we arrived, we found the hotel was in a shady area, but the hotel itself was very nice. The loby was beautifully decorated, and the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. They even watched the Preakness with us on the lobby TV. Room was great, extemely comfy beds, great shower, everyhting was clean and up to date. Bathroom was small, but clean and had a great shower and sink area. There was also a small refriederator located in the dresser, which came in handy with 4 unfinished meals from La Scala in Little Italy. The breakfast area was nicely decorated, and the breakfast itself was normal, featuring Holiday Inn Express's Signature Cinnamon Buns, Coffee, Breakfast Drinks, Sausage, Eggs, Bagels, Muffins, Yogurt, etc. There is a well-equipped fitness center with 2 wide screen flat-panel tv's, and a business center with 2 computers and a printer/copier. The pool area was nice, but closed. Ypu have to pay for parking, but the lot is pretty secure. It is fenced in, and a room key is needed to access it. The exit uses a motorized gate. Although there was a homeless man wandering around when we checked out. I would highly reccomend this hotel for business travelers and budget travelers to the Baltimore area. Remember, the hotel is in a bad area, so I wouldn't walk anywhere from there. Otherwise, everything was GREAT!

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Baltimore at the Stadiums
HotelInfo.Address: 1701 Russell Street, Baltimore, MD 21230
